snippet: Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda’s order to restart the Ohi nuclear plant made it the nation’s first to go back on line since the crisis last year in Fukushima.
abstract: Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda orders the reactivation of two nuclear reactors at a plant in western Japan, making it the nation’s first plant to go back online since the crisis in Fukushima; public remains deeply divided over the safety of nuclear power.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda’s order to restart the Ohi nuclear plant made it the nation’s first to go back on line since the crisis last year in Fukushima.

headline.seo: Japan’s Prime Minister Orders Restart of Two Nuclear Reactors
headline.main: Japan Public Still Divided as 2 Reactors to Be Opened
headline.print_headline: Japan Public Still Divided As 2 Reactors To Be Opened
